types.description: User changes a previously stated preference or slot value exactly once during the conversation.
User provides an invalid or nonsensical value when asked for a slot (e.g., time '12:68pm', impossible date, non-numeric party size).
User asks for something outside domain feasibility (e.g., after closing hours, party size too large).
User knows approximate information (e.g., order date, item name) but doesn't know exact identifiers (e.g., order_id).
User exhibits combative, frustrated, or difficult behavior (e.g., wants to talk to a human, passive-aggressive, in a rush, indecisive).
A tool returns an empty result set for a valid query.
The next tool call experiences a transient timeout; subsequent retry should be allowed to succeed.
A tool returns a persistent server error (e.g., HTTP 500) that does not resolve on retry. The error persists for all subsequent calls.
Tool rejects the request due to a malformed or missing input field.
Tool returns content that violates constraints or mismatches the query context (e.g., restaurants from the wrong city, wrong fields).
